text: welcome to daily video vocabulary a dose
of daily new English phrases and words
brought to you by let's talk podcast
calm
Pirlo English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 72 in today's
episode I have a new word for you
contemplate let's find out what it means
and how you can use it in your daily
conversation contemplate have you ever
thought about something very seriously
or deeply it could be to take a decision
or to analyze a problem to contemplate
basically means to look at something
thoughtfully and attentively or to think
about something very seriously if you
contemplate about something you actually
think whether to do it or not and you
ponder over it for a long time it also
means you consider doing something or
consider the possibility of something
happening for example when you are in
college you contemplate your future
goals that means you think about your
career very seriously by analyzing
various options as contemplate shows the
action of thinking or looking at
something attentively it is a verb okay
now that you know what contemplate means
let's take a look at some example
sentences to see how you can use it in
your daily conversation example one mr.
Roy is contemplating retirement next
year as he hasn't been keeping well for
a long time
example two Samantha told William thank
you for offering help I contemplated
doing the project myself but it would
have taken too long to complete it
example three when Smith was
contemplating a new business he
consulted competent finance legal and
tax advisors to ensure the viability of
his venture example for the class was
learning about caterpillars and their
transformation into butterflies but Lisa
couldn't contemplate how they could
change into completely different things
example five as Samantha was
contemplating a job change her boss
offered her arrays to avoid any brain
drain example six Michele contemplated
the result of her class tests thinking
what had gone wrong and how she could do
better the next time
example 7 my Aunt Lucy stared into the
mirror for a long time contemplating the
wrinkles on her face example 8 to
support his family
Alex contemplated leaving the high
school and taking up a full-time job at
the hotel
example nine Richard contemplated buying
a second-hand car for his daughter on
her birthday example 10 little angel
couldn't contemplate the meaning of the
poem and asked her mother for help
have you ever contemplated about
something for a long time or have you
done something that you regret and wish
you had contemplated a little more
before doing it kindly share your
experiences in the comment box below
this video thank you for watching us do
watch all the episodes of daily video
vocabulary to better your English
language skills do subscribe to our
Channel and stay updated with all the
latest lessons I will see you again
tomorrow with a new word or a idiom till
then bye and take care
